info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:04AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SCHUYLKILL AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 400 AM EDT... At 303 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Berwick, moving east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Tamaqua, Mahanoy City, Mcadoo, Hometown, Tuscarora, Oneida, Grier City-Park Crest, Delano, Nuremburg, Sheppton, Brandonville, Coaldale, Shumans, Ringtown, Kelayres, Park Place and Trenton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
